replies.body: So, when is {{champion:83}} getting that rework that was so long ago? Any rioters that can drop some hints?
Soon! Yorick will be sometime between now and the next new champion.

Will the team ever go back and take a look at Shen? His rework just didn't hit the mark for me. His Spirit Sword mechanic is interesting, but it just doesn't feel right on a champion like him. Also the fact that he got no new voice lines, particles, or recall makes the rework feel like it's unfinished. Compared to literally every other rework in the past year, his is by far the most poorly executed.

Currently we don't have anything planned. We have discussed giving a little love to him in the future, though nothing is certain yet. If tanks end up being the next class update we work on there is a good chance we give him a little love around then.

See, this tears me to pieces. My two favorite champions, Shen and Aatrox, are both on the board now to get some changes with roster updates. Assuming you do go with either divers or tanks and not some other class next, that probably won't even be until around mid next year, with the other class not even guaranteed to be after that. I think I'm starting to understand how all the Yorick, Urgot, and Galio mains out there feel.
{{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}
A year's wait is nothing compared to how those 3 feel.

morg's E interacts a lot lol, as anybody utility based, morg can be scary, I can't tell you how many times I've seen a morg shield a thresh or a blitz hook. That being said, her ult is really cool, but seems kinda weird with the rest of her kit she definitely needs a teamfighting ult, but it feels a little lackluster as it doesn't really interact with the rest of her kit. Other supports with a lot of skirmish potential have ults that simultaneously cover a weak spot in the kit and fit in with it. Braum's ult gives him more instant cc and an effective way to stop assassins yet at the same time fits his stand behind theme, karma can gain more aoe shielding/speed/damage, and still feels kitey, bard can freeze as many people as can fit in his circle which also sets him up for his unique q, and more, but with morg being a more backline support, her frontline ult doesn't seem to fit. and it just doesn't seem like she can easily set it up without either her team initiating or flashing. I love morg, but this just feels a little akward (althought to be honest I haven't tried it with protobelt). Her passive also feels a little outdated, doesn't really fit well with her kit. Morg's basic abilities are great though, and its satisfying to both qw and to e whoever needs it. Sorry about the rant

TL;DR morg's basic abilities are cool but her ult and passive could use a little love.
